60static int i915_getparam(struct drm_device *dev, void *data,
61 struct drm_file *file_priv)
62{
63 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
64 drm_i915_getparam_t *param = data;
65 int value;
66
67 switch (param->param) {
68 case I915_PARAM_IRQ_ACTIVE:
69 case I915_PARAM_ALLOW_BATCHBUFFER:
70 case I915_PARAM_LAST_DISPATCH:
71 /* Reject all old ums/dri params. */
72 return -ENODEV;
73 case I915_PARAM_CHIPSET_ID:
74 value = dev->pdev->device;
75 break;
76 case I915_PARAM_REVISION:
77 value = dev->pdev->revision;
78 break;
79 case I915_PARAM_HAS_GEM:
80 value = 1;
81 break;
82 case I915_PARAM_NUM_FENCES_AVAIL:
83 value = dev_priv->num_fence_regs;
84 break;
85 case I915_PARAM_HAS_OVERLAY:
86 value = dev_priv->overlay ? 1 : 0;
87 break;
88 case I915_PARAM_HAS_PAGEFLIPPING:
89 value = 1;
90 break;
91 case I915_PARAM_HAS_EXECBUF2:
92 /* depends on GEM */
93 value = 1;
94 break;
95 case I915_PARAM_HAS_BSD:
96 value = intel_ring_initialized(&dev_priv->ring[VCS]);
97 break;
98 case I915_PARAM_HAS_BLT:
99 value = intel_ring_initialized(&dev_priv->ring[BCS]);
100 break;
101 case I915_PARAM_HAS_VEBOX:
102 value = intel_ring_initialized(&dev_priv->ring[VECS]);
103 break;
104 case I915_PARAM_HAS_BSD2:
105 value = intel_ring_initialized(&dev_priv->ring[VCS2]);
106 break;
107 case I915_PARAM_HAS_RELAXED_FENCING:
108 value = 1;
109 break;
110 case I915_PARAM_HAS_COHERENT_RINGS:
111 value = 1;
112 break;
113 case I915_PARAM_HAS_EXEC_CONSTANTS:
114 value = INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 4;
115 break;
116 case I915_PARAM_HAS_RELAXED_DELTA:
117 value = 1;
118 break;
119 case I915_PARAM_HAS_GEN7_SOL_RESET:
120 value = 1;
121 break;
122 case I915_PARAM_HAS_LLC:
123 value = HAS_LLC(dev);
124 break;
125 case I915_PARAM_HAS_WT:
126 value = HAS_WT(dev);
127 break;
128 case I915_PARAM_HAS_ALIASING_PPGTT:
129 value = USES_PPGTT(dev);
130 break;
131 case I915_PARAM_HAS_WAIT_TIMEOUT:
132 value = 1;
133 break;
134 case I915_PARAM_HAS_SEMAPHORES:
135 value = i915_semaphore_is_enabled(dev);
136 break;
137 case I915_PARAM_HAS_PRIME_VMAP_FLUSH:
138 value = 1;
139 break;
140 case I915_PARAM_HAS_SECURE_BATCHES:
141#ifdef __NetBSD__
142 value = DRM_SUSER();
143#else
144 value = capable(CAP_SYS_ADMIN);
145#endif
146 break;
147 case I915_PARAM_HAS_PINNED_BATCHES:
148 value = 1;
149 break;
150 case I915_PARAM_HAS_EXEC_NO_RELOC:
151 value = 1;
152 break;
153 case I915_PARAM_HAS_EXEC_HANDLE_LUT:
154 value = 1;
155 break;
156 case I915_PARAM_CMD_PARSER_VERSION:
157 value = i915_cmd_parser_get_version();
158 break;
159 case I915_PARAM_HAS_COHERENT_PHYS_GTT:
160 value = 1;
161 break;
162 case I915_PARAM_MMAP_VERSION:
163#ifdef __NetBSD__
164 dev_priv->quirks |= QUIRK_NETBSD_VERSION_CALLED;
165#endif
166 value = 1;
167 break;
168 case I915_PARAM_SUBSLICE_TOTAL:
169 value = INTEL_INFO(dev)->subslice_total;
170 if (!value)
171 return -ENODEV;
172 break;
173 case I915_PARAM_EU_TOTAL:
174 value = INTEL_INFO(dev)->eu_total;
175 if (!value)
176 return -ENODEV;
177 break;
178 case I915_PARAM_HAS_GPU_RESET:
179 value = i915.enable_hangcheck &&
180 intel_has_gpu_reset(dev);
181 break;
182 case I915_PARAM_HAS_RESOURCE_STREAMER:
183 value = HAS_RESOURCE_STREAMER(dev);
184 break;
185 default:
186 DRM_DEBUG("Unknown parameter %d\n", param->param);
187 return -EINVAL;
188 }
189
190 if (copy_to_user(param->value, &value, sizeof(int))) {
191 DRM_ERROR("copy_to_user failed\n");
192 return -EFAULT;
193 }
194
195 return 0;
196}
197
198static int i915_get_bridge_dev(struct drm_device *dev)
199{
200 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
201
202 dev_priv->bridge_dev = pci_get_bus_and_slot(0, PCI_DEVFN(0, 0));
203 if (!dev_priv->bridge_dev) {
204 DRM_ERROR("bridge device not found\n");
205 return -1;
206 }
207 return 0;
208}
209
210#define MCHBAR_I915 0x44
211#define MCHBAR_I965 0x48
212#define MCHBAR_SIZE (4*4096)
213
214#define DEVEN_REG 0x54
215#define DEVEN_MCHBAR_EN (1 << 28)
216
217/* Allocate space for the MCH regs if needed, return nonzero on error */
218static int
219intel_alloc_mchbar_resource(struct drm_device *dev)
220{
221 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
222 int reg = INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 4 ? MCHBAR_I965 : MCHBAR_I915;
223#ifdef CONFIG_PNP
224 u32 temp_lo, temp_hi = 0;
225 u64 mchbar_addr;
226#endif
227 int ret;
228
229#ifdef CONFIG_PNP
230 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 4)
231 pci_read_config_dword(dev_priv->bridge_dev, reg + 4, &temp_hi);
232 pci_read_config_dword(dev_priv->bridge_dev, reg, &temp_lo);
233 mchbar_addr = ((u64)temp_hi << 32) | temp_lo;
234
235 /* If ACPI doesn't have it, assume we need to allocate it ourselves */
236 if (mchbar_addr &&
237 pnp_range_reserved(mchbar_addr, mchbar_addr + MCHBAR_SIZE))
238 return 0;
239#endif
240
241 /* Get some space for it */
242 dev_priv->mch_res.name = "i915 MCHBAR";
243 dev_priv->mch_res.flags = IORESOURCE_MEM;
244 ret = pci_bus_alloc_resource(dev_priv->bridge_dev->bus,
245 &dev_priv->mch_res,
246 MCHBAR_SIZE, MCHBAR_SIZE,
247 PCIBIOS_MIN_MEM,
248 0, pcibios_align_resource,
249 dev_priv->bridge_dev);
250 if (ret) {
251 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("failed bus alloc: %d\n", ret);
252 dev_priv->mch_res.start = 0;
253 return ret;
254 }
255
256 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 4)
257 pci_write_config_dword(dev_priv->bridge_dev, reg + 4,
258 upper_32_bits(dev_priv->mch_res.start));
259
260 pci_write_config_dword(dev_priv->bridge_dev, reg,
261 lower_32_bits(dev_priv->mch_res.start));
262 return 0;
263}
264
265/* Setup MCHBAR if possible, return true if we should disable it again */
266static void
267intel_setup_mchbar(struct drm_device *dev)
268{
269 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
270 int mchbar_reg = INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 4 ? MCHBAR_I965 : MCHBAR_I915;
271 u32 temp;
272 bool enabled;
273
274 if (IS_VALLEYVIEW(dev))
275 return;
276
277 dev_priv->mchbar_need_disable = false;
278
279 if (IS_I915G(dev) || IS_I915GM(dev)) {
280 pci_read_config_dword(dev_priv->bridge_dev, DEVEN_REG, &temp);
281 enabled = !!(temp & DEVEN_MCHBAR_EN);
282 } else {
283 pci_read_config_dword(dev_priv->bridge_dev, mchbar_reg, &temp);
284 enabled = temp & 1;
285 }
286
287 /* If it's already enabled, don't have to do anything */
288 if (enabled)
289 return;
290
291 if (intel_alloc_mchbar_resource(dev))
292 return;
293
294 dev_priv->mchbar_need_disable = true;
295
296 /* Space is allocated or reserved, so enable it. */
297 if (IS_I915G(dev) || IS_I915GM(dev)) {
298 pci_write_config_dword(dev_priv->bridge_dev, DEVEN_REG,
299 temp | DEVEN_MCHBAR_EN);
300 } else {
301 pci_read_config_dword(dev_priv->bridge_dev, mchbar_reg, &temp);
302 pci_write_config_dword(dev_priv->bridge_dev, mchbar_reg, temp | 1);
303 }
304}
305
306static void
307intel_teardown_mchbar(struct drm_device *dev)
308{
309 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
310 int mchbar_reg = INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 4 ? MCHBAR_I965 : MCHBAR_I915;
311 u32 temp;
312
313 if (dev_priv->mchbar_need_disable) {
314 if (IS_I915G(dev) || IS_I915GM(dev)) {
315 pci_read_config_dword(dev_priv->bridge_dev, DEVEN_REG, &temp);
316 temp &= ~DEVEN_MCHBAR_EN;
317 pci_write_config_dword(dev_priv->bridge_dev, DEVEN_REG, temp);
318 } else {
319 pci_read_config_dword(dev_priv->bridge_dev, mchbar_reg, &temp);
320 temp &= ~1;
321 pci_write_config_dword(dev_priv->bridge_dev, mchbar_reg, temp);
322 }
323 }
324
325 if (dev_priv->mch_res.start)
326 release_resource(&dev_priv->mch_res);
327}
328
329#ifndef __NetBSD__ /* XXX vga */
330/* true = enable decode, false = disable decoder */
331static unsigned int i915_vga_set_decode(void *cookie, bool state)
332{
333 struct drm_device *dev = cookie;
334
335 intel_modeset_vga_set_state(dev, state);
336 if (state)
337 return VGA_RSRC_LEGACY_IO | VGA_RSRC_LEGACY_MEM |
338 VGA_RSRC_NORMAL_IO | VGA_RSRC_NORMAL_MEM;
339 else
340 return VGA_RSRC_NORMAL_IO | VGA_RSRC_NORMAL_MEM;
341}
342
343static void i915_switcheroo_set_state(struct pci_dev *pdev, enum vga_switcheroo_state state)
344{
345 struct drm_device *dev = pci_get_drvdata(pdev);
346 pm_message_t pmm = { .event = PM_EVENT_SUSPEND };
347
348 if (state == VGA_SWITCHEROO_ON) {
349 pr_info("switched on\n");
350 dev->switch_power_state = DRM_SWITCH_POWER_CHANGING;
351 /* i915 resume handler doesn't set to D0 */
352 pci_set_power_state(dev->pdev, PCI_D0);
353 i915_resume_switcheroo(dev);
354 dev->switch_power_state = DRM_SWITCH_POWER_ON;
355 } else {
356 pr_err("switched off\n");
357 dev->switch_power_state = DRM_SWITCH_POWER_CHANGING;
358 i915_suspend_switcheroo(dev, pmm);
359 dev->switch_power_state = DRM_SWITCH_POWER_OFF;
360 }
361}
362
363static bool i915_switcheroo_can_switch(struct pci_dev *pdev)
364{
365 struct drm_device *dev = pci_get_drvdata(pdev);
366
367 /*
368 * FIXME: open_count is protected by drm_global_mutex but that would lead to
369 * locking inversion with the driver load path. And the access here is
370 * completely racy anyway. So don't bother with locking for now.
371 */
372 return dev->open_count == 0;
373}
374
375static const struct vga_switcheroo_client_ops i915_switcheroo_ops = {
376 .set_gpu_state = i915_switcheroo_set_state,
377 .reprobe = NULL,
378 .can_switch = i915_switcheroo_can_switch,
379};
380#endif
381
382static int i915_load_modeset_init(struct drm_device *dev)
383{
384 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
385 int ret;
386
387 ret = intel_parse_bios(dev);
388 if (ret)
389 DRM_INFO("failed to find VBIOS tables\n");
390
391#ifndef __NetBSD__ /* XXX vga */
392 /* If we have > 1 VGA cards, then we need to arbitrate access
393 * to the common VGA resources.
394 *
395 * If we are a secondary display controller (!PCI_DISPLAY_CLASS_VGA),
396 * then we do not take part in VGA arbitration and the
397 * vga_client_register() fails with -ENODEV.
398 */
399 ret = vga_client_register(dev->pdev, dev, NULL, i915_vga_set_decode);
400 if (ret && ret != -ENODEV)
401 goto out;
402#endif
403
404#ifdef __NetBSD__
405 intel_register_dsm_handler(dev);
406#else
407 intel_register_dsm_handler();
408#endif
409
410#ifndef __NetBSD__ /* XXX vga */
411 ret = vga_switcheroo_register_client(dev->pdev, &i915_switcheroo_ops, false);
412 if (ret)
413 goto cleanup_vga_client;
414#endif
415
416 /* Initialise stolen first so that we may reserve preallocated
417 * objects for the BIOS to KMS transition.
418 */
419 ret = i915_gem_init_stolen(dev);
420 if (ret)
421 goto cleanup_vga_switcheroo;
422
423 intel_power_domains_init_hw(dev_priv);
424
425 ret = intel_irq_install(dev_priv);
426 if (ret)
427 goto cleanup_gem_stolen;
428
429 intel_setup_gmbus(dev);
430
431 /* Important: The output setup functions called by modeset_init need
432 * working irqs for e.g. gmbus and dp aux transfers. */
433 intel_modeset_init(dev);
434
435 intel_guc_ucode_init(dev);
436
437 ret = i915_gem_init(dev);
438 if (ret)
439 goto cleanup_irq;
440
441 intel_modeset_gem_init(dev);
442
443 /* Always safe in the mode setting case. */
444 /* FIXME: do pre/post-mode set stuff in core KMS code */
445 dev->vblank_disable_allowed = true;
446 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->num_pipes == 0)
447 return 0;
448
449 ret = intel_fbdev_init(dev);
450 if (ret)
451 goto cleanup_gem;
452
453 /* Only enable hotplug handling once the fbdev is fully set up. */
454 intel_hpd_init(dev_priv);
455
456 /*
457 * Some ports require correctly set-up hpd registers for detection to
458 * work properly (leading to ghost connected connector status), e.g. VGA
459 * on gm45. Hence we can only set up the initial fbdev config after hpd
460 * irqs are fully enabled. Now we should scan for the initial config
461 * only once hotplug handling is enabled, but due to screwed-up locking
462 * around kms/fbdev init we can't protect the fdbev initial config
463 * scanning against hotplug events. Hence do this first and ignore the
464 * tiny window where we will loose hotplug notifactions.
465 */
466 async_schedule(intel_fbdev_initial_config, dev_priv);
467
468 drm_kms_helper_poll_init(dev);
469
470 return 0;
471
472cleanup_gem:
473 mutex_lock(&dev->struct_mutex);
474 i915_gem_cleanup_ringbuffer(dev);
475 i915_gem_context_fini(dev);
476 mutex_unlock(&dev->struct_mutex);
477cleanup_irq:
478 intel_guc_ucode_fini(dev);
479 drm_irq_uninstall(dev);
480 intel_teardown_gmbus(dev);
481cleanup_gem_stolen:
482 intel_modeset_cleanup(dev);
483 i915_gem_cleanup_stolen(dev);
484cleanup_vga_switcheroo:
485#ifndef __NetBSD__ /* XXX vga */
486 vga_switcheroo_unregister_client(dev->pdev);
487cleanup_vga_client:
488 vga_client_register(dev->pdev, NULL, NULL, NULL);
489out:
490#endif
491 return ret;
492}
493
494#if IS_ENABLED(CONFIG_FB)
495static int i915_kick_out_firmware_fb(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
496{
497 struct apertures_struct *ap;
498 struct pci_dev *pdev = dev_priv->dev->pdev;
499 bool primary;
500 int ret;
501
502 ap = alloc_apertures(1);
503 if (!ap)
504 return -ENOMEM;
505
506 ap->ranges[0].base = dev_priv->gtt.mappable_base;
507 ap->ranges[0].size = dev_priv->gtt.mappable_end;
508
509 primary =
510 pdev->resource[PCI_ROM_RESOURCE].flags & IORESOURCE_ROM_SHADOW;
511
512 ret = remove_conflicting_framebuffers(ap, "inteldrmfb", primary);
513
514 kfree(ap);
515
516 return ret;
517}
518#else
519static int i915_kick_out_firmware_fb(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
520{
521 return 0;
522}
523#endif
524
525#if !defined(CONFIG_VGA_CONSOLE)
526static int i915_kick_out_vgacon(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
527{
528 return 0;
529}
530#elif !defined(CONFIG_DUMMY_CONSOLE)
531static int i915_kick_out_vgacon(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
532{
533 return -ENODEV;
534}
535#else
536static int i915_kick_out_vgacon(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
537{
538 int ret = 0;
539
540 DRM_INFO("Replacing VGA console driver\n");
541
542 console_lock();
543 if (con_is_bound(&vga_con))
544 ret = do_take_over_console(&dummy_con, 0, MAX_NR_CONSOLES - 1, 1);
545 if (ret == 0) {
546 ret = do_unregister_con_driver(&vga_con);
547
548 /* Ignore "already unregistered". */
549 if (ret == -ENODEV)
550 ret = 0;
551 }
552 console_unlock();
553
554 return ret;
555}
556#endif
557
558static void i915_dump_device_info(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
559{
560 const struct intel_device_info *info = &dev_priv->info;
561
562#define PRINT_S(name) "%s"
563#define SEP_EMPTY
564#define PRINT_FLAG(name) info->name ? #name "," : ""
565#define SEP_COMMA ,
566 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("i915 device info: gen=%i, pciid=0x%04x rev=0x%02x flags="
567 DEV_INFO_FOR_EACH_FLAG(PRINT_S, SEP_EMPTY),
568 info->gen,
569 dev_priv->dev->pdev->device,
570 dev_priv->dev->pdev->revision,
571 DEV_INFO_FOR_EACH_FLAG(PRINT_FLAG, SEP_COMMA));
572#undef PRINT_S
573#undef SEP_EMPTY
574#undef PRINT_FLAG
575#undef SEP_COMMA
576}
577
578static void cherryview_sseu_info_init(struct drm_device *dev)
579{
580 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
581 struct intel_device_info *info;
582 u32 fuse, eu_dis;
583
584 info = (struct intel_device_info *)&dev_priv->info;
585 fuse = I915_READ(CHV_FUSE_GT);
586
587 info->slice_total = 1;
588
589 if (!(fuse & CHV_FGT_DISABLE_SS0)) {
590 info->subslice_per_slice++;
591 eu_dis = fuse & (CHV_FGT_EU_DIS_SS0_R0_MASK |
592 CHV_FGT_EU_DIS_SS0_R1_MASK);
593 info->eu_total += 8 - hweight32(eu_dis);
594 }
595
596 if (!(fuse & CHV_FGT_DISABLE_SS1)) {
597 info->subslice_per_slice++;
598 eu_dis = fuse & (CHV_FGT_EU_DIS_SS1_R0_MASK |
599 CHV_FGT_EU_DIS_SS1_R1_MASK);
600 info->eu_total += 8 - hweight32(eu_dis);
601 }
602
603 info->subslice_total = info->subslice_per_slice;
604 /*
605 * CHV expected to always have a uniform distribution of EU
606 * across subslices.
607 */
608 info->eu_per_subslice = info->subslice_total ?
609 info->eu_total / info->subslice_total :
610 0;
611 /*
612 * CHV supports subslice power gating on devices with more than
613 * one subslice, and supports EU power gating on devices with
614 * more than one EU pair per subslice.
615 */
616 info->has_slice_pg = 0;
617 info->has_subslice_pg = (info->subslice_total > 1);
618 info->has_eu_pg = (info->eu_per_subslice > 2);
619}
620
621static void gen9_sseu_info_init(struct drm_device *dev)
622{
623 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
624 struct intel_device_info *info;
625 int s_max = 3, ss_max = 4, eu_max = 8;
626 int s, ss;
627 u32 fuse2, s_enable, ss_disable, eu_disable;
628 u8 eu_mask = 0xff;
629
630 info = (struct intel_device_info *)&dev_priv->info;
631 fuse2 = I915_READ(GEN8_FUSE2);
632 s_enable = (fuse2 & GEN8_F2_S_ENA_MASK) >>
633 GEN8_F2_S_ENA_SHIFT;
634 ss_disable = (fuse2 & GEN9_F2_SS_DIS_MASK) >>
635 GEN9_F2_SS_DIS_SHIFT;
636
637 info->slice_total = hweight32(s_enable);
638 /*
639 * The subslice disable field is global, i.e. it applies
640 * to each of the enabled slices.
641 */
642 info->subslice_per_slice = ss_max - hweight32(ss_disable);
643 info->subslice_total = info->slice_total *
644 info->subslice_per_slice;
645
646 /*
647 * Iterate through enabled slices and subslices to
648 * count the total enabled EU.
649 */
650 for (s = 0; s < s_max; s++) {
651 if (!(s_enable & (0x1 << s)))
652 /* skip disabled slice */
653 continue;
654
655 eu_disable = I915_READ(GEN9_EU_DISABLE(s));
656 for (ss = 0; ss < ss_max; ss++) {
657 int eu_per_ss;
658
659 if (ss_disable & (0x1 << ss))
660 /* skip disabled subslice */
661 continue;
662
663 eu_per_ss = eu_max - hweight8((eu_disable >> (ss*8)) &
664 eu_mask);
665
666 /*
667 * Record which subslice(s) has(have) 7 EUs. we
668 * can tune the hash used to spread work among
669 * subslices if they are unbalanced.
670 */
671 if (eu_per_ss == 7)
672 info->subslice_7eu[s] |= 1 << ss;
673
674 info->eu_total += eu_per_ss;
675 }
676 }
677
678 /*
679 * SKL is expected to always have a uniform distribution
680 * of EU across subslices with the exception that any one
681 * EU in any one subslice may be fused off for die
682 * recovery. BXT is expected to be perfectly uniform in EU
683 * distribution.
684 */
685 info->eu_per_subslice = info->subslice_total ?
686 DIV_ROUND_UP(info->eu_total,
687 info->subslice_total) : 0;
688 /*
689 * SKL supports slice power gating on devices with more than
690 * one slice, and supports EU power gating on devices with
691 * more than one EU pair per subslice. BXT supports subslice
692 * power gating on devices with more than one subslice, and
693 * supports EU power gating on devices with more than one EU
694 * pair per subslice.
695 */
696 info->has_slice_pg = ((IS_SKYLAKE(dev) || IS_KABYLAKE(dev)) &&
697 (info->slice_total > 1));
698 info->has_subslice_pg = (IS_BROXTON(dev) && (info->subslice_total > 1));
699 info->has_eu_pg = (info->eu_per_subslice > 2);
700}
701
702static void broadwell_sseu_info_init(struct drm_device *dev)
703{
704 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
705 struct intel_device_info *info;
706 const int s_max = 3, ss_max = 3, eu_max = 8;
707 int s, ss;
708 u32 fuse2, eu_disable[3], s_enable, ss_disable;
709
710 fuse2 = I915_READ(GEN8_FUSE2);
711 s_enable = (fuse2 & GEN8_F2_S_ENA_MASK) >> GEN8_F2_S_ENA_SHIFT;
712 ss_disable = (fuse2 & GEN8_F2_SS_DIS_MASK) >> GEN8_F2_SS_DIS_SHIFT;
713
714 eu_disable[0] = I915_READ(GEN8_EU_DISABLE0) & GEN8_EU_DIS0_S0_MASK;
715 eu_disable[1] = (I915_READ(GEN8_EU_DISABLE0) >> GEN8_EU_DIS0_S1_SHIFT) |
716 ((I915_READ(GEN8_EU_DISABLE1) & GEN8_EU_DIS1_S1_MASK) <<
717 (32 - GEN8_EU_DIS0_S1_SHIFT));
718 eu_disable[2] = (I915_READ(GEN8_EU_DISABLE1) >> GEN8_EU_DIS1_S2_SHIFT) |
719 ((I915_READ(GEN8_EU_DISABLE2) & GEN8_EU_DIS2_S2_MASK) <<
720 (32 - GEN8_EU_DIS1_S2_SHIFT));
721
722
723 info = (struct intel_device_info *)&dev_priv->info;
724 info->slice_total = hweight32(s_enable);
725
726 /*
727 * The subslice disable field is global, i.e. it applies
728 * to each of the enabled slices.
729 */
730 info->subslice_per_slice = ss_max - hweight32(ss_disable);
731 info->subslice_total = info->slice_total * info->subslice_per_slice;
732
733 /*
734 * Iterate through enabled slices and subslices to
735 * count the total enabled EU.
736 */
737 for (s = 0; s < s_max; s++) {
738 if (!(s_enable & (0x1 << s)))
739 /* skip disabled slice */
740 continue;
741
742 for (ss = 0; ss < ss_max; ss++) {
743 u32 n_disabled;
744
745 if (ss_disable & (0x1 << ss))
746 /* skip disabled subslice */
747 continue;
748
749 n_disabled = hweight8(eu_disable[s] >> (ss * eu_max));
750
751 /*
752 * Record which subslices have 7 EUs.
753 */
754 if (eu_max - n_disabled == 7)
755 info->subslice_7eu[s] |= 1 << ss;
756
757 info->eu_total += eu_max - n_disabled;
758 }
759 }
760
761 /*
762 * BDW is expected to always have a uniform distribution of EU across
763 * subslices with the exception that any one EU in any one subslice may
764 * be fused off for die recovery.
765 */
766 info->eu_per_subslice = info->subslice_total ?
767 DIV_ROUND_UP(info->eu_total, info->subslice_total) : 0;
768
769 /*
770 * BDW supports slice power gating on devices with more than
771 * one slice.
772 */
773 info->has_slice_pg = (info->slice_total > 1);
774 info->has_subslice_pg = 0;
775 info->has_eu_pg = 0;
776}
777
778/*
779 * Determine various intel_device_info fields at runtime.
780 *
781 * Use it when either:
782 * - it's judged too laborious to fill n static structures with the limit
783 * when a simple if statement does the job,
784 * - run-time checks (eg read fuse/strap registers) are needed.
785 *
786 * This function needs to be called:
787 * - after the MMIO has been setup as we are reading registers,
788 * - after the PCH has been detected,
789 * - before the first usage of the fields it can tweak.
790 */
791static void intel_device_info_runtime_init(struct drm_device *dev)
792{
793 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
794 struct intel_device_info *info;
795 enum i915_pipe pipe;
796
797 info = (struct intel_device_info *)&dev_priv->info;
798
799 /*
800 * Skylake and Broxton currently don't expose the topmost plane as its
801 * use is exclusive with the legacy cursor and we only want to expose
802 * one of those, not both. Until we can safely expose the topmost plane
803 * as a DRM_PLANE_TYPE_CURSOR with all the features exposed/supported,
804 * we don't expose the topmost plane at all to prevent ABI breakage
805 * down the line.
806 */
807 if (IS_BROXTON(dev)) {
808 info->num_sprites[PIPE_A] = 2;
809 info->num_sprites[PIPE_B] = 2;
810 info->num_sprites[PIPE_C] = 1;
811 } else if (IS_VALLEYVIEW(dev))
812 for_each_pipe(dev_priv, pipe)
813 info->num_sprites[pipe] = 2;
814 else
815 for_each_pipe(dev_priv, pipe)
816 info->num_sprites[pipe] = 1;
817
818 if (i915.disable_display) {
819 DRM_INFO("Display disabled (module parameter)\n");
820 info->num_pipes = 0;
821 } else if (info->num_pipes > 0 &&
822 (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen == 7 || INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen == 8) &&
823 !IS_VALLEYVIEW(dev)) {
824 u32 fuse_strap = I915_READ(FUSE_STRAP);
825 u32 sfuse_strap = I915_READ(SFUSE_STRAP);
826
827 /*
828 * SFUSE_STRAP is supposed to have a bit signalling the display
829 * is fused off. Unfortunately it seems that, at least in
830 * certain cases, fused off display means that PCH display
831 * reads don't land anywhere. In that case, we read 0s.
832 *
833 * On CPT/PPT, we can detect this case as SFUSE_STRAP_FUSE_LOCK
834 * should be set when taking over after the firmware.
835 */
836 if (fuse_strap & ILK_INTERNAL_DISPLAY_DISABLE ||
837 sfuse_strap & SFUSE_STRAP_DISPLAY_DISABLED ||
838 (dev_priv->pch_type == PCH_CPT &&
839 !(sfuse_strap & SFUSE_STRAP_FUSE_LOCK))) {
840 DRM_INFO("Display fused off, disabling\n");
841 info->num_pipes = 0;
842 }
843 }
844
845 /* Initialize slice/subslice/EU info */
846 if (IS_CHERRYVIEW(dev))
847 cherryview_sseu_info_init(dev);
848 else if (IS_BROADWELL(dev))
849 broadwell_sseu_info_init(dev);
850 else if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 9)
851 gen9_sseu_info_init(dev);
852
853 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("slice total: %u\n", info->slice_total);
854 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("subslice total: %u\n", info->subslice_total);
855 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("subslice per slice: %u\n", info->subslice_per_slice);
856 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("EU total: %u\n", info->eu_total);
857 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("EU per subslice: %u\n", info->eu_per_subslice);
858 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("has slice power gating: %s\n",
859 info->has_slice_pg ? "y" : "n");
860 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("has subslice power gating: %s\n",
861 info->has_subslice_pg ? "y" : "n");
862 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("has EU power gating: %s\n",
863 info->has_eu_pg ? "y" : "n");
864}
865
866static void intel_init_dpio(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
867{
868 if (!IS_VALLEYVIEW(dev_priv))
869 return;
870
871 /*
872 * IOSF_PORT_DPIO is used for VLV x2 PHY (DP/HDMI B and C),
873 * CHV x1 PHY (DP/HDMI D)
874 * IOSF_PORT_DPIO_2 is used for CHV x2 PHY (DP/HDMI B and C)
875 */
876 if (IS_CHERRYVIEW(dev_priv)) {
877 DPIO_PHY_IOSF_PORT(DPIO_PHY0) = IOSF_PORT_DPIO_2;
878 DPIO_PHY_IOSF_PORT(DPIO_PHY1) = IOSF_PORT_DPIO;
879 } else {
880 DPIO_PHY_IOSF_PORT(DPIO_PHY0) = IOSF_PORT_DPIO;
881 }
882}
883
884/**
885 * i915_driver_load - setup chip and create an initial config
886 * @dev: DRM device
887 * @flags: startup flags
888 *
889 * The driver load routine has to do several things:
890 * - drive output discovery via intel_modeset_init()
891 * - initialize the memory manager
892 * - allocate initial config memory
893 * - setup the DRM framebuffer with the allocated memory
894 */
895int i915_driver_load(struct drm_device *dev, unsigned long flags)
896{
897 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv;
898 struct intel_device_info *info, *device_info;
899 int ret = 0, mmio_bar, mmio_size;
900 uint32_t aperture_size;
901
902 info = (struct intel_device_info *) flags;
903
904 dev_priv = kzalloc(sizeof(*dev_priv), GFP_KERNEL);
905 if (dev_priv == NULL)
906 return -ENOMEM;
907
908 dev->dev_private = dev_priv;
909 dev_priv->dev = dev;
910
911 /* Setup the write-once "constant" device info */
912 device_info = (struct intel_device_info *)&dev_priv->info;
913 memcpy(device_info, info, sizeof(dev_priv->info));
914 device_info->device_id = dev->pdev->device;
915
916 spin_lock_init(&dev_priv->irq_lock);
917 spin_lock_init(&dev_priv->gpu_error.lock);
918#ifdef __NetBSD__
919 linux_mutex_init(&dev_priv->backlight_lock);
920#else
921 mutex_init(&dev_priv->backlight_lock);
922#endif
923 spin_lock_init(&dev_priv->uncore.lock);
924 spin_lock_init(&dev_priv->mm.object_stat_lock);
925 spin_lock_init(&dev_priv->mmio_flip_lock);
926#ifdef __NetBSD__
927 linux_mutex_init(&dev_priv->sb_lock);
928 linux_mutex_init(&dev_priv->modeset_restore_lock);
929 linux_mutex_init(&dev_priv->csr_lock);
930 linux_mutex_init(&dev_priv->av_mutex);
931#else
932 mutex_init(&dev_priv->sb_lock);
933 mutex_init(&dev_priv->modeset_restore_lock);
934 mutex_init(&dev_priv->csr_lock);
935 mutex_init(&dev_priv->av_mutex);
936#endif
937
938 intel_pm_setup(dev);
939
940 intel_display_crc_init(dev);
941
942 i915_dump_device_info(dev_priv);
943
944 /* Not all pre-production machines fall into this category, only the
945 * very first ones. Almost everything should work, except for maybe
946 * suspend/resume. And we don't implement workarounds that affect only
947 * pre-production machines. */
948 if (IS_HSW_EARLY_SDV(dev))
949 DRM_INFO("This is an early pre-production Haswell machine. "
950 "It may not be fully functional.\n");
951
952 if (i915_get_bridge_dev(dev)) {
953 ret = -EIO;
954 goto free_priv;
955 }
956
957 mmio_bar = IS_GEN2(dev) ? 1 : 0;
958 /* Before gen4, the registers and the GTT are behind different BARs.
959 * However, from gen4 onwards, the registers and the GTT are shared
960 * in the same BAR, so we want to restrict this ioremap from
961 * clobbering the GTT which we want ioremap_wc instead. Fortunately,
962 * the register BAR remains the same size for all the earlier
963 * generations up to Ironlake.
964 */
965 if (info->gen < 5)
966 mmio_size = 512*1024;
967 else
968 mmio_size = 2*1024*1024;
969
970 dev_priv->regs = pci_iomap(dev->pdev, mmio_bar, mmio_size);
971#ifdef __NetBSD__
972 if (!dev_priv->regs)
973 dev_priv->regs = drm_agp_borrow(dev, mmio_bar, mmio_size);
974#endif
975 if (!dev_priv->regs) {
976 DRM_ERROR("failed to map registers\n");
977 ret = -EIO;
978 goto put_bridge;
979 }
980
981#ifdef __NetBSD__
982 dev_priv->regs_bst = dev_priv->dev->pdev->pd_resources[mmio_bar].bst;
983 dev_priv->regs_bsh = dev_priv->dev->pdev->pd_resources[mmio_bar].bsh;
984#endif
985
986 /* This must be called before any calls to HAS_PCH_* */
987 intel_detect_pch(dev);
988
989 intel_uncore_init(dev);
990
991 /* Load CSR Firmware for SKL */
992 intel_csr_ucode_init(dev);
993
994 ret = i915_gem_gtt_init(dev);
995 if (ret)
996 goto out_freecsr;
997
998 /* WARNING: Apparently we must kick fbdev drivers before vgacon,
999 * otherwise the vga fbdev driver falls over. */
1000 ret = i915_kick_out_firmware_fb(dev_priv);
1001 if (ret) {
1002 DRM_ERROR("failed to remove conflicting framebuffer drivers\n");
1003 goto out_gtt;
1004 }
1005
1006 ret = i915_kick_out_vgacon(dev_priv);
1007 if (ret) {
1008 DRM_ERROR("failed to remove conflicting VGA console\n");
1009 goto out_gtt;
1010 }
1011
1012 pci_set_master(dev->pdev);
1013
1014#ifndef __NetBSD__ /* Handled in i915_gem_gtt. */
1015 /* overlay on gen2 is broken and can't address above 1G */
1016 if (IS_GEN2(dev))
1017 dma_set_coherent_mask(&dev->pdev->dev, DMA_BIT_MASK(30));
1018
1019 /* 965GM sometimes incorrectly writes to hardware status page (HWS)
1020 * using 32bit addressing, overwriting memory if HWS is located
1021 * above 4GB.
1022 *
1023 * The documentation also mentions an issue with undefined
1024 * behaviour if any general state is accessed within a page above 4GB,
1025 * which also needs to be handled carefully.
1026 */
1027 if (IS_BROADWATER(dev) || IS_CRESTLINE(dev))
1028 dma_set_coherent_mask(&dev->pdev->dev, DMA_BIT_MASK(32));
1029#endif
1030
1031 aperture_size = dev_priv->gtt.mappable_end;
1032
1033#ifdef __NetBSD__
1034 dev_priv->gtt.mappable =
1035 drm_io_mapping_create_wc(dev, dev_priv->gtt.mappable_base,
1036 aperture_size);
1037 /* Note: mappable_end is the size, not end paddr, of the aperture. */
1038 pmap_pv_track(dev_priv->gtt.mappable_base, dev_priv->gtt.mappable_end);
1039#else
1040 dev_priv->gtt.mappable =
1041 io_mapping_create_wc(dev_priv->gtt.mappable_base,
1042 aperture_size);
1043#endif
1044 if (dev_priv->gtt.mappable == NULL) {
1045 ret = -EIO;
1046 goto out_gtt;
1047 }
1048
1049 dev_priv->gtt.mtrr = arch_phys_wc_add(dev_priv->gtt.mappable_base,
1050 aperture_size);
1051
1052 /* The i915 workqueue is primarily used for batched retirement of
1053 * requests (and thus managing bo) once the task has been completed
1054 * by the GPU. i915_gem_retire_requests() is called directly when we
1055 * need high-priority retirement, such as waiting for an explicit
1056 * bo.
1057 *
1058 * It is also used for periodic low-priority events, such as
1059 * idle-timers and recording error state.
1060 *
1061 * All tasks on the workqueue are expected to acquire the dev mutex
1062 * so there is no point in running more than one instance of the
1063 * workqueue at any time. Use an ordered one.
1064 */
1065 dev_priv->wq = alloc_ordered_workqueue("i915", 0);
1066 if (dev_priv->wq == NULL) {
1067 DRM_ERROR("Failed to create our workqueue.\n");
1068 ret = -ENOMEM;
1069 goto out_mtrrfree;
1070 }
1071
1072 dev_priv->hotplug.dp_wq = alloc_ordered_workqueue("i915-dp", 0);
1073 if (dev_priv->hotplug.dp_wq == NULL) {
1074 DRM_ERROR("Failed to create our dp workqueue.\n");
1075 ret = -ENOMEM;
1076 goto out_freewq;
1077 }
1078
1079 dev_priv->gpu_error.hangcheck_wq =
1080 alloc_ordered_workqueue("i915-hangcheck", 0);
1081 if (dev_priv->gpu_error.hangcheck_wq == NULL) {
1082 DRM_ERROR("Failed to create our hangcheck workqueue.\n");
1083 ret = -ENOMEM;
1084 goto out_freedpwq;
1085 }
1086
1087 intel_irq_init(dev_priv);
1088 intel_uncore_sanitize(dev);
1089
1090 /* Try to make sure MCHBAR is enabled before poking at it */
1091 intel_setup_mchbar(dev);
1092 intel_opregion_setup(dev);
1093
1094 i915_gem_load(dev);
1095
1096 /* On the 945G/GM, the chipset reports the MSI capability on the
1097 * integrated graphics even though the support isn't actually there
1098 * according to the published specs. It doesn't appear to function
1099 * correctly in testing on 945G.
1100 * This may be a side effect of MSI having been made available for PEG
1101 * and the registers being closely associated.
1102 *
1103 * According to chipset errata, on the 965GM, MSI interrupts may
1104 * be lost or delayed, but we use them anyways to avoid
1105 * stuck interrupts on some machines.
1106 */
1107 if (!IS_I945G(dev) && !IS_I945GM(dev))
1108 pci_enable_msi(dev->pdev);
1109
1110 intel_device_info_runtime_init(dev);
1111
1112 intel_init_dpio(dev_priv);
1113
1114 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->num_pipes) {
1115 ret = drm_vblank_init(dev, INTEL_INFO(dev)->num_pipes);
1116 if (ret)
1117 goto out_gem_unload;
1118 }
1119
1120 intel_power_domains_init(dev_priv);
1121
1122 ret = i915_load_modeset_init(dev);
1123 if (ret < 0) {
1124 DRM_ERROR("failed to init modeset\n");
1125 goto out_power_well;
1126 }
1127
1128 /*
1129 * Notify a valid surface after modesetting,
1130 * when running inside a VM.
1131 */
1132 if (intel_vgpu_active(dev))
1133 I915_WRITE(vgtif_reg(display_ready), VGT_DRV_DISPLAY_READY);
1134
1135 i915_setup_sysfs(dev);
1136
1137 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->num_pipes) {
1138 /* Must be done after probing outputs */
1139 intel_opregion_init(dev);
1140 acpi_video_register();
1141 }
1142
1143 if (IS_GEN5(dev))
1144 intel_gpu_ips_init(dev_priv);
1145
1146 intel_runtime_pm_enable(dev_priv);
1147
1148 i915_audio_component_init(dev_priv);
1149
1150 return 0;
1151
1152out_power_well:
1153 intel_power_domains_fini(dev_priv);
1154 drm_vblank_cleanup(dev);
1155out_gem_unload:
1156 WARN_ON(unregister_oom_notifier(&dev_priv->mm.oom_notifier));
1157 unregister_shrinker(&dev_priv->mm.shrinker);
1158 /* XXX i915_gem_unload */
1159#ifdef __NetBSD__
1160 linux_mutex_destroy(&dev_priv->fb_tracking.lock);
1161 DRM_DESTROY_WAITQUEUE(&dev_priv->pending_flip_queue);
1162 spin_lock_destroy(&dev_priv->pending_flip_lock);
1163 DRM_DESTROY_WAITQUEUE(&dev_priv->gpu_error.reset_queue);
1164 spin_lock_destroy(&dev_priv->gpu_error.reset_lock);
1165#endif
1166 kmem_cache_destroy(dev_priv->requests);
1167 kmem_cache_destroy(dev_priv->vmas);
1168 kmem_cache_destroy(dev_priv->objects);
1169 /* XXX end i915_gem_unload */
1170
1171 if (dev->pdev->msi_enabled)
1172 pci_disable_msi(dev->pdev);
1173
1174 intel_teardown_mchbar(dev);
1175 pm_qos_remove_request(&dev_priv->pm_qos);
1176 destroy_workqueue(dev_priv->gpu_error.hangcheck_wq);
1177out_freedpwq:
1178 destroy_workqueue(dev_priv->hotplug.dp_wq);
1179out_freewq:
1180 destroy_workqueue(dev_priv->wq);
1181out_mtrrfree:
1182 arch_phys_wc_del(dev_priv->gtt.mtrr);
1183#ifdef __NetBSD__
1184 /* Note: mappable_end is the size, not end paddr, of the aperture. */
1185 pmap_pv_untrack(dev_priv->gtt.mappable_base,
1186 dev_priv->gtt.mappable_end);
1187#endif
1188 io_mapping_free(dev_priv->gtt.mappable);
1189out_gtt:
1190 i915_global_gtt_cleanup(dev);
1191out_freecsr:
1192 intel_csr_ucode_fini(dev);
1193 intel_uncore_fini(dev);
1194 pci_iounmap(dev->pdev, dev_priv->regs);
1195put_bridge:
1196 pci_dev_put(dev_priv->bridge_dev);
1197free_priv:
1198 /* XXX intel_pm_fini */
1199#ifdef __NetBSD__
1200 spin_lock_destroy(&dev_priv->rps.client_lock);
1201 linux_mutex_destroy(&dev_priv->rps.hw_lock);
1202#endif
1203 /* XXX end intel_pm_fini */
1204#ifdef __NetBSD__
1205 linux_mutex_destroy(&dev_priv->av_mutex);
1206 linux_mutex_destroy(&dev_priv->csr_lock);
1207 linux_mutex_destroy(&dev_priv->modeset_restore_lock);
1208 linux_mutex_destroy(&dev_priv->sb_lock);
1209 spin_lock_destroy(&dev_priv->mmio_flip_lock);
1210 spin_lock_destroy(&dev_priv->mm.object_stat_lock);
1211 spin_lock_destroy(&dev_priv->uncore.lock);
1212 linux_mutex_destroy(&dev_priv->backlight_lock);
1213 spin_lock_destroy(&dev_priv->gpu_error.lock);
1214 spin_lock_destroy(&dev_priv->irq_lock);
1215#endif
1216 kfree(dev_priv);
1217 return ret;
1218}
1219
1220int i915_driver_unload(struct drm_device *dev)
1221{
1222 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1223 int ret;
1224
1225 i915_audio_component_cleanup(dev_priv);
1226
1227 ret = i915_gem_suspend(dev);
1228 if (ret) {
1229 DRM_ERROR("failed to idle hardware: %d\n", ret);
1230 return ret;
1231 }
1232
1233 intel_power_domains_fini(dev_priv);
1234
1235 intel_gpu_ips_teardown();
1236
1237 i915_teardown_sysfs(dev);
1238
1239 WARN_ON(unregister_oom_notifier(&dev_priv->mm.oom_notifier));
1240 unregister_shrinker(&dev_priv->mm.shrinker);
1241
1242 io_mapping_free(dev_priv->gtt.mappable);
1243 arch_phys_wc_del(dev_priv->gtt.mtrr);
1244
1245 acpi_video_unregister();
1246
1247 intel_fbdev_fini(dev);
1248
1249 drm_vblank_cleanup(dev);
1250
1251 intel_modeset_cleanup(dev);
1252
1253 /*
1254 * free the memory space allocated for the child device
1255 * config parsed from VBT
1256 */
1257 if (dev_priv->vbt.child_dev && dev_priv->vbt.child_dev_num) {
1258 kfree(dev_priv->vbt.child_dev);
1259 dev_priv->vbt.child_dev = NULL;
1260 dev_priv->vbt.child_dev_num = 0;
1261 }
1262 kfree(dev_priv->vbt.sdvo_lvds_vbt_mode);
1263 dev_priv->vbt.sdvo_lvds_vbt_mode = NULL;
1264 kfree(dev_priv->vbt.lfp_lvds_vbt_mode);
1265 dev_priv->vbt.lfp_lvds_vbt_mode = NULL;
1266
1267#ifndef __NetBSD__ /* XXX vga */
1268 vga_switcheroo_unregister_client(dev->pdev);
1269 vga_client_register(dev->pdev, NULL, NULL, NULL);
1270#endif
1271
1272 /* Free error state after interrupts are fully disabled. */
1273 cancel_delayed_work_sync(&dev_priv->gpu_error.hangcheck_work);
1274 i915_destroy_error_state(dev);
1275
1276 if (dev->pdev->msi_enabled)
1277 pci_disable_msi(dev->pdev);
1278
1279 intel_opregion_fini(dev);
1280
1281 /* Flush any outstanding unpin_work. */
1282 flush_workqueue(dev_priv->wq);
1283
1284 intel_guc_ucode_fini(dev);
1285 mutex_lock(&dev->struct_mutex);
1286 i915_gem_cleanup_ringbuffer(dev);
1287 i915_gem_context_fini(dev);
1288 mutex_unlock(&dev->struct_mutex);
1289 intel_fbc_cleanup_cfb(dev_priv);
1290 i915_gem_cleanup_stolen(dev);
1291
1292 intel_csr_ucode_fini(dev);
1293
1294 intel_teardown_mchbar(dev);
1295
1296 destroy_workqueue(dev_priv->hotplug.dp_wq);
1297 destroy_workqueue(dev_priv->wq);
1298 destroy_workqueue(dev_priv->gpu_error.hangcheck_wq);
1299 pm_qos_remove_request(&dev_priv->pm_qos);
1300
1301 i915_global_gtt_cleanup(dev);
1302
1303 intel_uncore_fini(dev);
1304 if (dev_priv->regs != NULL)
1305 pci_iounmap(dev->pdev, dev_priv->regs);
1306
1307 /* XXX i915_gem_unload */
1308#ifdef __NetBSD__
1309 linux_mutex_destroy(&dev_priv->fb_tracking.lock);
1310 DRM_DESTROY_WAITQUEUE(&dev_priv->pending_flip_queue);
1311 spin_lock_destroy(&dev_priv->pending_flip_lock);
1312 DRM_DESTROY_WAITQUEUE(&dev_priv->gpu_error.reset_queue);
1313 spin_lock_destroy(&dev_priv->gpu_error.reset_lock);
1314#endif
1315 /* XXX end i915_gem_unload */
1316 kmem_cache_destroy(dev_priv->requests);
1317 kmem_cache_destroy(dev_priv->vmas);
1318 kmem_cache_destroy(dev_priv->objects);
1319 /* XXX intel_pm_fini */
1320#ifdef __NetBSD__
1321 spin_lock_destroy(&dev_priv->rps.client_lock);
1322 linux_mutex_destroy(&dev_priv->rps.hw_lock);
1323#endif
1324 /* XXX end intel_pm_fini */
1325 pci_dev_put(dev_priv->bridge_dev);
1326 kfree(dev_priv);
1327
1328 return 0;
1329}
1330
1331int i915_driver_open(struct drm_device *dev, struct drm_file *file)
1332{
1333 int ret;
1334
1335 ret = i915_gem_open(dev, file);
1336 if (ret)
1337 return ret;
1338
1339 return 0;
1340}
1341
1342/**
1343 * i915_driver_lastclose - clean up after all DRM clients have exited
1344 * @dev: DRM device
1345 *
1346 * Take care of cleaning up after all DRM clients have exited. In the
1347 * mode setting case, we want to restore the kernel's initial mode (just
1348 * in case the last client left us in a bad state).
1349 *
1350 * Additionally, in the non-mode setting case, we'll tear down the GTT
1351 * and DMA structures, since the kernel won't be using them, and clea
1352 * up any GEM state.
1353 */
1354void i915_driver_lastclose(struct drm_device *dev)
1355{
1356 intel_fbdev_restore_mode(dev);
1357#ifndef __NetBSD__ /* XXX vga */
1358 vga_switcheroo_process_delayed_switch();
1359#endif
1360}
1361
1362void i915_driver_preclose(struct drm_device *dev, struct drm_file *file)
1363{
1364 mutex_lock(&dev->struct_mutex);
1365 i915_gem_context_close(dev, file);
1366 i915_gem_release(dev, file);
1367 mutex_unlock(&dev->struct_mutex);
1368
1369 intel_modeset_preclose(dev, file);
1370}
1371
1372void i915_driver_postclose(struct drm_device *dev, struct drm_file *file)
1373{
1374 struct drm_i915_file_private *file_priv = file->driver_priv;
1375
1376#ifdef __NetBSD__
1377 spin_lock_destroy(&file_priv->mm.lock);
1378#endif
1379
1380 if (file_priv && file_priv->bsd_ring)
1381 file_priv->bsd_ring = NULL;
1382 kfree(file_priv);
1383}
1384
1385static int
1386i915_gem_reject_pin_ioctl(struct drm_device *dev, void *data,
1387 struct drm_file *file)
1388{
1389 return -ENODEV;
1390}
